pullRequest.body:
As a follow-up to splitting `RingTheory/Algebraic.lean`, also split `AlgebraicIndependent.lean`.

This PR creates the following new files:
* `AlgebraicIndependent/Defs.lean`: definition of `AlgebraicIndependent` and `IsTranscendenceBasis`
* `AlgebraicIndependent/Basic.lean`: basic results on `AlgebraicIndependent`
* `AlgebraicIndependent/TranscendenceBasis.lean`: basic results on `TranscendenceBasis`
* `AlgebraicIndependent/Adjoin.lean`: relating `AlgebraicIndependent` and `IntermediateField.adjoin`
* `AlgebraicIndependent/Transcendental.lean`: relating `AlgebraicIndependent`, `Transcendental` and `Algebraic`
* `AlgebraicIndependent/RankAndCardinality.lean`: about the rank/cardinality of `TranscendenceBasis`es

---

- [x] depends on: #19370

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

Good work! I think I'll come back after #19370 is merged, as currently the diffs are too big.

Thanks for the effort!
Thanks for the effort!

```suggestion
```

These are now unused.
```suggestion
namespace AlgebraicIndependent
```
Do we still need this section? It has the same scope as the `namespace` section enclosing it.

```suggestion
variable {Î¹ Î¹' : Type*} (R : Type*) {K A A' : Type*} (x : Î¹ â†’ A)
```
Do we need this section?
I'd argue this is worth keeping, both for guiding the reader and for delimiting where we have `hx` as an assumption.

```suggestion
  AlgHom.ext hx.aeval_repr
```
It would be good to check which of these are actually used in each file. I think `u v w` are not used in this file.

```suggestion
variable {Î¹ Î¹' R K A A' : Type*} {x : Î¹ â†’ A}
variable [CommRing R] [CommRing A] [CommRing A'] [Algebra R A] [Algebra R A']
```

```suggestion
theorem AlgebraicIndependent.repr_ker (hx : AlgebraicIndependent R x) :
    RingHom.ker (hx.repr : adjoin R (range x) â†’+* MvPolynomial Î¹ R) = âŠ¥ :=
  (RingHom.injective_iff_ker_eq_bot _).1 (AlgEquiv.injective _)
```
(untested)

```suggestion
namespace AlgebraicIndependent

theorem mono {t s : Set A} (h : t âŠ† s)
    (hx : AlgebraicIndependent R ((â†‘) : s â†’ A)) : AlgebraicIndependent R ((â†‘) : t â†’ A) := by
  simpa [Function.comp] using hx.comp (inclusion h) (inclusion_injective h)
```

unused
```suggestion
```
A section with the same name as the file probably doesn't serve a purpose ...

I'd guess K, Î¹' and A' may not be used in every file ...
```suggestion
variable {Î¹ Î¹' R K A A' : Type*} {x : Î¹ â†’ A}
variable [CommRing R] [CommRing A] [CommRing A'] [Algebra R A] [Algebra R A']
```

pullRequest.title: chore(RingTheory): split `AlgebraicIndependent.lean`
